definition: lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush

sentences.english: Let me be straight with u.
He likes to come straight to the point without beating about the bush.
sentences.chinese: 他说话喜欢单刀直入，不绕弯子。

definition: lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush

to encircle/to go around/to circle/to beat about the bush
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)

not to mince words/not to beat about the bush

definition: to talk in riddles
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
direct and plainspoken (idiom); blunt/straightforward
to keep listeners in suspense (in storytelling)/to keep people on tenterhooks
going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)

bend/turn/curve
